body:
Comment 3 by **francois.genolini**: 
So is it the documentation of the -i flag that is incorrect?
If the -i flag was actually intended to work as documented in:

<<
what 'go install' would create
>>

then the bug that I have reported is valid, and the initial line of the help file should
be re-written as:

<<
Clean removes object files from package source directories, unless the -i option is
given, in which case the files in the bin and pkg folders will be removed too.
>>

If this is not a bug, then the -i flag is not much used, and should be removed as it
contradicts the first line of the help text.
